panels.title: Overview

panels.content:
Cisco Systems - UCS Traffic Monitoring - Ingress Congestion

This page helps to find the real cause of the ingress traffic congestion on a FI uplink port.

panels.description: Assumption: The uplink must be a port-channel. A similar graph can be generated for non-port-channel uplinks
panels.title: $domain - FI-$fi_id - Uplink - $uplink - RX Utilization

panels.description: Assumption: The uplink must be a port-channel. A similar graph can be generated for non-port-channel uplinks
panels.title: $domain - FI-$fi_id - Uplink - $uplink - TX Utilization

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find real cause of ingress traffic congestion on a FI uplink port **How to use**: Select a UCS domain, FI ID and an uplink port. Select All Backplane ports. Graphs on the left show PAUSE frame activity on IOM backplane ports. PAUSE frames may be exchanged under normal condition also. So, find unusual PAUSE frame activity with below symptoms (not an exhaustive list): - PAUSE frame rate in tens or hundreds per second is probably fine. Pay attention to thousands or tens-of-thousands per second. Millions per second definitely need investigation. - Look for spike in PAUSE frame rate. Low stable values are probably fine. - Does one port among many other similar ports has higher PAUSE frame activity? For example, does one FI server port (between FI and IOM) stand out than rest of the other ports connected to the same chassis? Once you have a suspect backplane port with unusual PAUSE frame activity, look at the graph on the right which shows the service profile and vNIC/vHBA using that backplane port. High traffic rate or traffic spikes, especially with matching timestamp with unusual PAUSE frame activity, indicates that high utilization is the cause of congestion. **Details**: - A blade server sends PAUSE frames to IOM backplane port if it is unable to receive the traffic at the ingress rate. These frames are reported as RX PAUSE on IOM backplane ports. - PAUSE frames are not reported at per vNIC/vHBA granularity.
panels.title: RX PAUSE on backplane port $bp_port
RX Traffic from backplane port $bp_port to vIFs
Backplane port $bp_port - PAUSE frames VS ingress traffic on vIF pinned to uplink $uplink on FI-$fi_id - size to side comparison

list.definition: show tag values from FIEnvStats with key=domain where $timeFilter
list.label: UCS Domain
list.name: domain
list.query: show tag values from FIEnvStats with key=domain where $timeFilter

list.definition: show tag values from VnicStats with key=pinned_uplink where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/ and  $timeFilter
list.label: Uplink Port
list.name: uplink
list.query: show tag values from VnicStats with key=pinned_uplink where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/ and  $timeFilter

list.definition: show tag values from VnicStats with key=peer_port where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/ and pinned_uplink =~ /$uplink/ and  $timeFilter
list.label: Backplane Port
list.name: bp_port
list.query: show tag values from VnicStats with key=peer_port where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/ and pinned_uplink =~ /$uplink/ and  $timeFilter

title: FI Uplink port - Ingress congestion monitoring
